description: Person-level measures. As many of these measures are collected at 'baseline' it is currently called 'baseline.' However, this is a slight misnomer as, for example, current_study_status is dynamically updated.

fields.name: jdc_person_id
fields.title: JCOIN data commons person identifier
fields.description: The generated unique identifier specific to the JCOIN Data Commons for a given individual (client or staff).

fields.name: visit_number
fields.title: Visit Number
fields.description: A number that identifies the visit or timepoint of data collection (baseline=1 and each subsequent follow up is 2 or greater).

fields.name: shifted_visit_dt
fields.title: Visit Date (shifted)
fields.description: This is the date of the visit (ie time point) after shifting by a random number 182 days before or 182 days after the actual visit date. The shifting is done on the individual level which retains the time interval between visits (and allows calculations of days between time points or other date fields which are shifted by the same number of days). To avoid issues with type conversion errors, the date is of type integer

fields.name: visit_type
fields.title: Visit Type
fields.description: The visit type/category (either baseline or follow up)

fields.name: quarter_enrolled
fields.title: Quarter Enrolled
fields.description: The financial quarter and year of enrollment

fields.name: staff_type
fields.title: Staff Type
fields.description: The type of staff (Court Coordinator, Judge, Law Enforcement, Lawyer, Peer, Treatment)

fields.name: current_study_status
fields.title: Current Study Status
fields.description: A summary of the current status of staff member's involvement in study

fields.name: d1a
fields.title: Age
fields.description: About how old are you? (top coded at 90)

fields.name: o1
fields.title: Sex at birth
fields.description: What sex was originally listed on your birth certificate?

fields.name: o2
fields.title: Gender Identity
fields.description: What is your gender identity?

enum: Genderqueer/gender nonconforming/neither exclusively male nor female

custom.notes:
For gender/orientation/identity, use items O1-O2 if possible, otherwise use D4a-D4c.   [Must use one or the other.] 
 False if not 'Male' and not 'Transfgender' else True

fields.name: d4b
fields.title: Gender Identity (condensed)
fields.description: What is your gender identity?

custom.notes: For gender/orientation/identity, use items O1-O2 if possible, otherwise use D4a-D4c.   [Must use one or the other.]

fields.name: d3_white
fields.title: Race: White
fields.description: [White] What is your race? SELECT ALL THAT APPLY

fields.name: d3_black
fields.title: Race: Black or African American
fields.description: [Black or African American] What is your race? SELECT ALL THAT APPLY

fields.name: d3_american_indian
fields.title: Race: American Indian or Alaska Native
fields.description: [American Indian or Alaska Native] What is your race? SELECT ALL THAT APPLY

fields.name: d3_hawaiian
fields.title: Race: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander
fields.description: [Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander] What is your race? SELECT ALL THAT APPLY

fields.name: d3_asian
fields.title: Race: Asian
fields.description: [Asian] What is your race? SELECT ALL THAT APPLY

fields.name: d3_other
fields.title: Race: Other
fields.description: [Other] What is your race? SELECT ALL THAT APPLY

fields.name: d3_specify_tribe
fields.title: Race: American indian principal tribe or community specified
fields.description: [American indian principal tribe or community specified] What is your race? SELECT ALL THAT APPLY

fields.name: d3_specify_other
fields.title: Race: Other specified
fields.description: [Other specified] What is your race? SELECT ALL THAT APPLY

fields.name: d2
fields.title: Hispanic, Latino, or Spanish Origin
fields.description: Are you of Hispanic, Latino, or Spanish origin?

fields.name: d4c
fields.title: Sexual orientation
fields.description: Sexual orientation:  Do you think of yourself as

fields.name: d4c_specify_other
fields.title: Sexual orientation:  Other specified
fields.description: Sexual orientation:  Do you think of yourself as

fields.name: d4d
fields.title: Ever pregnant
fields.description: Have you ever been pregnant?

enum: Previously pregnant, did not have a child

custom.notes: Does this just apply to that past 90 days?  If not, then the participant should be able to check more than one response.

fields.name: d5
fields.title: Marital status
fields.description: What is your marital status?

fields.name: d5a
fields.title: Married with partner
fields.description: Are you currently living as married with a romantic partner?

enum: Yes, I am living as married with partner
No, I am not living as married with partner

fields.name: d6
fields.title: Education
fields.description: What is the highest grade or level of school you have completed or the highest degree you have received?

enum: Some college credit but less than 1 year of college credit
1 or more years of college credit but no degree
Graduate degree (e.g., MSW, MA, MS, JD, MD, DSW, EdD, PhD)

fields.name: d6_grade
fields.title: Education:  Highest grade level (if less than GED or h.s. diploma)
fields.description: What is the highest grade completed?

fields.name: d6_specify_other
fields.title: Education: Other specified
fields.description: What is the highest grade or level of school you have completed or the highest degree you have received?

fields.name: or1
fields.title: Confidence to implement
fields.description: Rate each of the following statements on a 5-point scale where 1=Disagree and 5=Agree [People who work here feel confident that the organization can get people invested in implementing [intervention].]]

fields.name: or2
fields.title: Commitment to implement
fields.description: Rate each of the following statements on a 5-point scale where 1=Disagree and 5=Agree [People who work here feel committed to implementing [intervention].]

fields.name: or3
fields.title: Confidence in tracking
fields.description: Rate each of the following statements on a 5-point scale where 1=Disagree and 5=Agree [People who work here feel confident that they can keep track of progress in implementing [intervention].]

fields.name: or4
fields.title: Whatever it takes attitude to implement
fields.description: Rate each of the following statements on a 5-point scale where 1=Disagree and 5=Agree [People who work here will do whatever it takes to implement [intervention].]

fields.name: or5
fields.title: Confidence in organizational support
fields.description: Rate each of the following statements on a 5-point scale where 1=Disagree and 5=Agree [People who work here feel feel confident that the organization can support people as they adjust to [intervention].]

fields.name: or6
fields.title: Want to implement
fields.description: Rate each of the following statements on a 5-point scale where 1=Disagree and 5=Agree [People who work here want to implement [intervention]]

fields.name: or7
fields.title: Confidence in maintaining momentum
fields.description: Rate each of the following statements on a 5-point scale where 1=Disagree and 5=Agree [People who work here feel confident that they can keep the momentum going in implementing [intervention].]

fields.name: or8
fields.title: Confidence in handling challenges
fields.description: Rate each of the following statements on a 5-point scale where 1=Disagree and 5=Agree [People who work here feel confident that they can handle the challenges that might arise in implementing [intervention].]

fields.name: or9
fields.title: Determination in implementating
fields.description: Rate each of the following statements on a 5-point scale where 1=Disagree and 5=Agree [People who work here are determined to implement [intervention].]

fields.name: or10
fields.title: Confidence in coordinating tasks
fields.description: Rate each of the following statements on a 5-point scale where 1=Disagree and 5=Agree [People who work here feel confident that they can coordinate tasks so that implementation goes smoothly.]

fields.name: or11
fields.title: Motivation to implement
fields.description: Rate each of the following statements on a 5-point scale where 1=Disagree and 5=Agree [People who work here are motivated to implement [intervention].]

fields.name: or12
fields.title: Confidence in managing politics
fields.description: Rate each of the following statements on a 5-point scale where 1=Disagree and 5=Agree [People who work here feel confident that they can manage the politics of implementing [intervention].]

fields.name: oc1
fields.title: Pressure
fields.description: Rate each of the following items on a scale of 1-5 where 1=Disagree and 5=Agree [Staff members are under too much pressure to do their jobs effectively]

fields.name: oc2
fields.title: Stress and strain signs
fields.description: Rate each of the following items on a scale of 1-5 where 1=Disagree and 5=Agree [Staff members are under too much pressure to do their jobs effectively]

fields.name: oc3
fields.title: Heavy workload
fields.description: Rate each of the following items on a scale of 1-5 where 1=Disagree and 5=Agree [Staff members are under too much pressure to do their jobs effectively]

fields.name: oc4
fields.title: Frustration
fields.description: Rate each of the following items on a scale of 1-5 where 1=Disagree and 5=Agree [Staff members are under too much pressure to do their jobs effectively]
